nodes.bodyText:
I'd choose a better-fitting name for this method. It's not a "read-only" get, I think its intent is to populate the request based on given action, so maybe populateRequestFromAction, setupRequestFromAction, ... would be better.


The logic is non-trivial and the reader should get some idea, what's going on, when the aid has been passed (which happens, when we're forwarding from the action page, IIUC). That's why I'd suggest:

a comment in that if block from which this method is called
a javadoc for this method
both
You are right I should add some comments about whats going on here
Nit: you could use a shortcut here: Channel.isBaseChannel().
IIUC, the addon products of this product set will always be empty, which means empty list will be passed to the request on line 490. Is this intention?
AddonProducts are handled properly now
Nit: I think camelCase would be more readable.
Nit: I think the comparison to true is not needed, just requestScope.completed && requestScope.typedistupgradedryrun  should do fine.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -91,7 +91,17 @@ - +

nodes.bodyText: You are right and I wouldn't have done it. But I wanted to stick to the style the rest of the file uses
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -91,7 +91,17 @@ - +

nodes.bodyText: The confirm sounds very general given its task (forwarding to SPMigration). I'd be favor in a specific name (spmigration).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3232,6 +3232,8 @@
                  path="/WEB-INF/pages/systems/sdc/history_event.jsp"/>
         <forward name="continue"
                  path="/systems/details/history/History.do"/>
+        <forward name="confirm"

nodes.bodyText:
Agreed. In the beginning I thought it would need to be confirm, since the forward in the SPMigrationAction is also called confirm, but that isn't the case.
So I will change it to spmigration
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3232,6 +3232,8 @@

         <forward name="continue"
                  path="/systems/details/history/History.do"/>
+        <forward name="confirm"

nodes.bodyText: Would it be possible to check for STATUS_COMPLETED && typedistupgradedryrun to restrict the forward to SP Migration only to the cases when the action is completed and we deal with dry run?
Well the button wouldn't show otherwise and that code would not be executed anyway, but for consistency I will add the check here as well. 👍
Could this condition be simplified? ${!requestScope.completed}.

nodes.bodyText: The getMigrationTargets evokes something that doesn't have side-effects. I think that at least a comment in javadoc about populating that MISSING_SUCCESSOR_EXTENSIONS attribute would be good.

nodes.bodyText:
I'd suggest being more specific in the method arguments:

instead of ctx you can pass the user directly,
instead of the server, you can pass channelArch directly.

Passing more specific params makes their purpose more clear here.

nodes.bodyText: Can it be that there are multiple valid migration target with the same base product? Is selecting the first one the right thing to do?
